page.title: 11Annual Events in St. Agnes
page.content: It's a Knock-out is organised annually by the Parish Church,in Beaconsfield Playing Field. Teams are drawn from various sports clubs and from the three pubs. Started in Jubilee year, the Victorian Fayre on the second May Bank Holiday involves most organisations. Stalls are set up in the main street, which is closed to traffic. Helpers, in costume, parade through the street led by the Town Crier and St.Agnes Silver Band. The Annual Carnival in August is the highlight of the year, being considered one of the best in the County. The "Queen" and her attendants lead the procession from the field, where the entrants are judged, through the village to Rosemundy and back to the field where the prizes are presented. Visiting Bands join with St. Agnes to give a concert later.
